item.title: Report E-2025040498
item.description:
Report E-2025040498

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-17
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The forklift loader made an error loading the pallet which included the 4 hazmat boxes on to a platform inside the trailer when the boxes dropped off the pallet. The spilled product was absorbed by the packaging. The damaged containers were removed from their packages and placed in an overpack in preparation for disposition.

item.description:
Report X-2025041359

  • City: YORKTOWN HGTS

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THIS PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED IMMEDIATELY UPON OPENING THE TRAILER DOOR. CRUSHED AND LEAKING. UNLOADER PROMPTLY CALLED RESPONDER AND THE PACKAGE WAS CAREFULLY TRANSPORTED TO DMP FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025040339
item.description:
Report E-2025040339

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-12T03:42:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-14
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 14, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all impacted materials in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The damaged pail was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum as well.
